class FileUtilities[source]

FileUtilities()

Set of utility functions for managing the requirements of the Ultralytics repo

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Generation[source]

Generation(repo, out_dir, data_yaml, verbose=False, resource_dirs=['train', 'valid', 'test'])

Container and organizer of photos for a given repository. This class "softly" organizes the files upon the setting of the split attribute via set_split.

The split can then be written to disk by calling write_split_to_disk. The relevant data will be zipped in out_dir

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

There is a two-step confirmation before making any changes to disk. First, crawl through the repo and collect all images and collect all labels. Labels must be in YOLOv5 format.

{% raw %} 
g = Generation(repo="./Image Repo/labeled/Final Roboflow Export (841)", 
               out_dir="testing_01_split",
               data_yaml=Defaults().data_yaml)

#crawl through the `repo`. On colab, may take some time to execute
g.set_split()
#take a look at the sizes of split
g.get_split()

[{'train': 589}, {'valid': 169}, {'test': 83}]
{% endraw %}

For testing, I might use the repo differently.

{% raw %} 
custom_split = {"train": .5, "valid": .3, "test": .2}
g.set_split(split_ratio=custom_split, MAX_SIZE=10)
g.get_split()

[{'train': 5}, {'valid': 3}, {'test': 2}]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
g.write_split_to_disk(descriptor="<01_split>")
import IPython
IPython.display.clear_output()
print("Complete: ", g.out_dir)

Complete:  testing_01_split

for dir in g.resource_dirs:
  for files in os.listdir(dir):
    print(len(files))

custom_split = {"train": .5, "valid": .3, "test": .1}
g.set_split(split_ratio=custom_split, MAX_SIZE=6)
g.get_split()

[{'train': 3}, {'valid': 2}, {'test': 1}]
